documentation.title: ENDF-6 file from ENDF/B version 8.1.0 translated to GNDS by FUDGE.
documentation.endfCompatible:
8-O - 0 NDS,IAEA Eval-Aug23 D.E.Cullen NDS-IAEA-224 DIST-AUG24 REV1-NOV23 20240830 ---- ENDF/B-VIII.1 MATERIAL 800 REVISION 1 ----- ATOMIC RELAXATION DATA ------ ENDF-6 ================================================================== The Livermore Evaluated Atomic Data Library (EADL) in the ENDF-6 Format. Translated from the Livermore ENDL format to the ENDF-6 Format. ================================================================== Contents ================================================================== MF/MT Description ================================================================== 28/533 Atomic Relaxation Data for Electrons and Photons ================================================================== Warning ================================================================== MF/MT combinations used to define ALL electron interaction data are newly defined MF/MT numbers for ENDF/B-VI that did not exist in earlier versions of ENDF/B. ================================================================== Definition of Data ================================================================== Atomic Relaxation Data for Electrons and Photons ================================================================== 1) An atom can be ionized by a photon or an electron interaction. 2) The atomic relaxation data included here describes how a singly ionized atom returns to neutrality, by emitting photons (x-rays) and/or electrons (Auger, Coster-Kronig). 3) Data is given to define the transition probabilities between subshells for radiative (x-ray emission) and non-radiative (Auger, Coster-Kronig) transitions. 4) The complete spectrum of emitted photons and electrons can be calculated using the data included here, e.g., see ref. 2, below, for am example of a computer code that analytically calculates these spectra. ================================================================== References ================================================================== 1) S.T. Perkins, D.E. Cullen, etal., "Tables and Graphs of Atomic Subshell and Relaxation Data Derived from the LLNL Evaluated Atomic Data Library (EADL), Z = 1 - 100", UCRL-50400, Vol. 30, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (1991). 2) D.E. Cullen "Program RELAX: A Code Designed to Calculate X-Ray and Electron Emission Spectra as Singly Charged Atoms Relax Back to Neutrality", UCRL-ID-110438, Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (1992). 3) D.E. Cullen "A Survey of Atomic Binding Energies for use in EPICS2017" ,IAEA-NDS-224, (2017), Nuclear Data Section, IAEA, Vienna, Austria 4) D.E. Cullen,"EPICS2017: April 2019 Status Report", IAEA-NDS-228, April 2019, Nuclear Data Section, IAEA, Vienna, Austria. 5) D.E. Cullen,"EPICS2023: August 2023 Status Report", IAEA-NDS-242, August 2023, Nuclear Data Section, IAEA, Vienna, Austria.
These are the primary references to the contents of this library and they contain a complete list of references to the sources of data used in this library, methods of evaluation, accuracy of the data, etc. ================================================================== History ================================================================== (1) November, 1991 - Initial release in the ENDL format. (2) November, 2001 - Initial release in the ENDF-6 format. (3) September,2014 - Insure Standard C, C++, FORTRAN Format (4) September,2014 - Updated based on recently publshed data (5) September,2017 - New Binding Energies (see: ref.3) Same Transition Probabilities (6) August, 2023 - Reformatted, but data same as 2017 version ================================================================== ***************** Program FIXUP (Version 2023-2) **************** **************** Program DICTIN (VERSION 2023-1) ****************
